message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.AI, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of weakly supervised temporal action detection in untrimmed videos, which is a task related to computer vision (CV). Therefore, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. The paper proposes a novel approach that involves training a detector by progressively erasing video clips and using a series of classifiers to find new actionness clips. This approach involves machine learning (ML) techniques such as classification and detection, which are covered in sub-categories cs.LG and cs.MM. The paper also uses a fully connected conditional random field to refine the temporal localization outputs, which is a technique related to artificial intelligence (AI) and inference (cs.AI). Finally, the paper evaluates its approach on two datasets, which involves experimental evaluation (cs.IR).
